definitions.definition: a period of twenty-four hours as a unit of time, reckoned from one midnight to the next, corresponding to a rotation of the earth on its axis.
examples: a twenty-four-hour period, twenty-four hours I stayed for a day

definitions.definition: the part of a day when it is light; the time between sunrise and sunset.
examples: she sleeps all day and goes out at night
synonyms: daylight; waking hours "enjoy the beach during the day"

definitions.definition: the part of a day spent working.
a single rotation of a planet in relation to its primary.
the period on a planet when its primary star is above the horizon.

examples: by the time they had all gone it was broad day

definitions.definition: a particular period of the past; an era.
examples: the laws were very strict in those days
synonyms: generation "the leading architect of the day"

definitions.definition: a day associated with a particular event or purpose.
a day's endeavor, or the period of an endeavor, especially as bringing success.
examples: speed and surprise would win the day

definitions.definition: a particular period in a person's life or career.
the successful, fortunate, or influential period of a person's life or career.
examples: noun: one's day; plural noun: one's days
